result.execSummary:
The defendant Kristin A Guimond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kristin A Guimond is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kristin A Guimond was found guilty of Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: $67 VW surcharge to be paid by the defendant to the Clerk of Courts office within 60 days.  $200 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted.
DNA on file.  Bail conditions continue until report date.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or _X_ Random Drug Testing. 
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release. 
- Defendant shall not be at any Walmart.
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.
- Maintain absolute sobriety.
- Defendant shall be in her home located at 58 Bel Air Dr., Madison, WI 53713 from 6pm - 6am except for the purpose of work and travelling to and from work.
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

2:11 PM Defendant Kristin A Guimond in court, in custody.  Attorney Shaun W O'Connell in court for Kristin A Guimond.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.
